node.title: Wellington rain: Some roads to remain closed overnight
node.description: A number of roads around Wellington will remain closed overnight due to heavy rain. Meanwhile, parts of the city have had more rain today than in a normal D-ecember.

node.title: Man arrested in Invercargill after person shot in Winton
node.description: A 19-year-old man has been arrested after a firearms incident in Winton, Southland earlier today.

node.title: Some pharmacies criticised for charging to print vaccine passes
node.description: The Pharmaceutical Society says it is disappointing some pharmacies are charging people who want their vaccine passes printed. Audio

node.title: 230,000-plus of ham and pepperoni recalled for listeria
node.description: Perdue Premium Meat Co. unit says fully cooked pork products may be contaminated with infection-causing bacteria.

node.title: Restaurant apologizes for denying service to police officers
node.description: The owners of the brunch eatery backtracked on Instagram Sunday.

node.title: Exxon Mobil aims for net-zero emissions from its operations in the Permian Basin by 2030.
node.description: Exxon plans to reduce greenhouse gas emissions across its business, bit its goal does not include offsetting emissions from its customers, such as car and truck owners and airlines.

node.title: Pope Exploring a 2nd Meeting With Russian Orthodox Church
node.description: Speaking after his trip to Cyprus and Greece, Francis also said he had no choice but to accept the resignation of the archbishop of Paris because of the harmful gossip surrounding him.

node.title: NASA Telescope Launching This Week Will Study Some of the Universe's Most Violent Objects
node.description: The Imaging X-ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE) spacecraft will observe polarized light from powerful objects in the cosmos, such as black holes and neutron stars.

node.title: Internet Slams Man Who 'Destroyed' Girlfriend's Family Heirloom Ring to Propose
node.description: His wife-to-be "said yes immediately and was absolutely elated, until she saw the ring."

node.title: China Accuses U.S. of 'Grandstanding' With Expected Diplomatic Boycott of Beijing Olympics
node.description: "If the U.S. side is bent on going its own way, China will take firm countermeasures," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said.

node.title: 10 Russian Citizens Returning from South Africa Positive for COVID, 2 with Omicron Variant
node.description: Russia announced the first cases of Omicron variant after 10 citizens returned from South Africa and tested positive for COVID, two of which were for Omicron.

node.title: Entangled Whale Mom and Her Calf Filmed Off the Coast of Georgia
node.description: The critically endangered whale, dubbed Snow Cone, is one of just 70 breeding females left on Earth.

node.title: Trump Calls for Biden to 'Leave Office' Over Rising COVID-19 Deaths
node.description: At the current COVID-19 death rate, the number of American lives lost under Biden could exceed those under Trump in a few weeks.

node.title: Just 2 Percent of Hispanics Use the Term 'Latinx,' 40 Percent Find It Offensive: Poll
node.description: "Why are we using a word that is preferred by only 2 percent, but offends as many as 40 percent of those voters we want to win?," said one of the pollsters.

node.title: What Are The Oath Keepers Accused Of Ahead Of January 6 Conspiracy Trial?
node.description: A total of 17 members of far-right militia group are accused of conspiring to violently stop the certification of the 2020 Election result.

node.title: What to Cook Right Now
node.description: Now’s as good a time as any for pork gyros and chocolate with peppermint frosting.

node.title: Alana Haim Surprised Everyone With Her Movie Debut. Even Herself.
node.description: When Paul Thomas Anderson asked her to star in “Licorice Pizza,” the musician had zero acting experience. Now she’s winning rave reviews.

node.title: When Will Spotify Wrapped 2021 End? Last Day To Check Your Annual Roundup Revealed
node.description: The ability to view your 2021 Spotify Wrapped will eventually be removed. Here is how long you have left before the slideshow feature is gone for good.

node.title: Ex-Myanmar Leader Suu Kyi Gets 2 Years in Prison, More Sentencing Expected Next Week
node.description: The former Myanmar state counsellor ousted by military in February was convicted of incitement and violating COVID restrictions.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Family Asks Merrick Garland to Improve Her Treatment in Prison
node.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is on trial for allegedly assisting Jeffery Epstein in the sexual abuse of girls as young as 14.

node.title: Haitian gang releases 3 more hostages, U.S. religious group says
node.description: There are 12 adults and five children in the group of 16 U.S. citizens and one Canadian, including an 8-month-old.

node.title: Adele’s ‘30’ Holds at No. 1 for a Second Week
node.description: Michael Bublé’s “Christmas” is No. 3 and the Vince Guaraldi Trio’s soundtrack to “A Charlie Brown Christmas” is No. 10, as holiday releases start filling playlists.

node.title: Did the World Chess Championship End When No One Was Looking?
node.description: With two wins in his pocket, Magnus Carlsen knows only a huge stumble will keep from retaining the world title he has held since 2013.

node.title: Eric Adams, New York’s mayor-elect, does not commit to the new vaccine mandate for private employers.
node.description: A spokesman for Mr. Adams said he would review the mandate, along with some other city pandemic measures, after he takes office in January, succeeding Bill de Blasio.

node.title: Three of a Group of Missionaries Kidnapped in Haiti Have Been Released
node.description: The U.S. Christian aid group said three more people were released from a group of 17 that had been kidnapped by a gang in Haiti. Two had been released last month.

node.title: 8 Women and 8 Men: Germany Gets Its First Gender-Equal Cabinet
node.description: Angela Merkel is handing over the chancellery to a man. But in a watershed moment for the country, women will run all security and diplomacy-related ministries in the new government.

node.title: Italian Police Conducting Random Checks to Enforce Restrictions on COVID Unvaccinated
node.description: Italy's law enforcement is able to access information on an individual's vaccination or testing status through its multitiered Green Pass.

node.title: Trump Doubles Down on Testing Negative for COVID Ahead of 2020 Debate With Biden
node.description: "Biden goes around coughing on people all over the place, and yet the Corrupt News doesn't even cover it," the former president said.

node.title: NYC first in U.S. to require vaccine for private sector employers
node.description: "We in New York City have decided to use a preemptive strike to really do something bold to stop the further growth of COVID," Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

node.title: Genre-Blurring, Politically Charged Opera Wins Top Music Prize
node.description: Olga Neuwirth’s “Orlando,” an adaptation of Virginia Woolf that jolted a conservative opera house, received the $100,000 Grawemeyer Award.
